verses.verse: Plea for Judgment of False Accusers To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. [1] Do (Ps. 83:1) not keep silent, O God of my praise!
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful Have opened against me; They have spoken against me with a (Ps. 27:12) lying tongue.
They have also surrounded me with words of hatred, And fought against me (Ps. 35:7; 69:4; John 15:25) without a cause.
In return for my love they are my accusers, But I give myself to prayer.
Thus (Ps. 35:7, 12; 38:20; Prov. 17:13) they have rewarded me evil for good, And hatred for my love.
Set a wicked man over him, And let (Zech. 3:1) an accuser stand at his right hand.
When he is judged, let him be found guilty, And ((Prov. 28:9)) let his prayer become sin.
Let his days be ((Ps. 55:23); John 17:12) few, And (Ps. 69:25; Acts 1:20) let another take his office.
(Ex. 22:24) Let his children be fatherless, And his wife a widow.
Let his children continually be vagabonds, and beg; Let them seek their bread also from their desolate places.
(Neh. 5:7; Job 5:5; 18:9) Let the creditor seize all that he has, And let strangers plunder his labor.
Let there be none to extend mercy to him, Nor let there be any to favor his fatherless children.
(Job 18:19; Ps. 37:28) Let his posterity be cut off, And in the generation following let their (Prov. 10:7) name be blotted out.
((Ex. 20:5; Num. 14:18); Is. 65:6; (Jer. 32:18)) Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the LORD, And let not the sin of his mother (Neh. 4:5; Jer. 18:23) be blotted out.
Let them be continually before the LORD, That He may (Job 18:17; (Ps. 34:16)) cut off the memory of them from the earth;
Because he did not remember to show mercy, But persecuted the poor and needy man, That he might even slay the ((Ps. 34:18)) broken in heart.
(Prov. 14:14; (Matt. 7:2)) As he loved cursing, so let it come to him; As he did not delight in blessing, so let it be far from him.
As he clothed himself with cursing as with his garment, So let it (Num. 5:22) enter his body like water, And like oil into his bones.
Let it be to him like the garment which covers him, And for a belt with which he girds himself continually.
Let this be the LORD’s reward to my accusers, And to those who speak evil against my person.
But You, O GOD the Lord, Deal with me for Your name’s sake; Because Your mercy is good, deliver me.
For I am poor and needy, And my heart is wounded within me.
I am gone (Ps. 102:11) like a shadow when it lengthens; I am shaken off like a locust.
My (Heb. 12:12) knees are weak through fasting, And my flesh is feeble from lack of fatness.
I also have become (Ps. 22:7; Jer. 18:16; Lam. 2:15) a reproach to them; When they look at me, (Matt. 27:39; Mark 15:29) they shake their heads.
Help me, O LORD my God! Oh, save me according to Your mercy,
(Job 37:7) That they may know that this is Your hand— That You, LORD, have done it!
(2 Sam. 6:11, 12) Let them curse, but You bless; When they arise, let them be ashamed, But let (Is. 65:14) Your servant rejoice.
(Job 8:22; Ps. 35:26) Let my accusers be clothed with shame, And let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a mantle.
I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; Yes, (Ps. 35:18; 111:1) I will praise Him among the multitude.
For ((Ps. 16:8)) He shall stand at the right hand of the poor, To save him from those who condemn him.
